lines.text: I wouldn't ride on that stage again if it means staying in this town for the rest of my life - heaven forbid.
[Boggsie recognizes Dan as an undercover postal inspector]
I never forget a face.
In this case forget mine.
Where is this Elliott I hear so much about?
His office is over there... with the "Mister" on it.
lines.character: Singer, Pals of the Golden West

lines.text: That mail contract is worth $15,000. I can afford to be generous.
I haven't noticed it.
Maybe our luck will change.
Not as long as Elliott is after the mail contract.
You mean Elliott is our bad luck?
If he's crazy enough to drive, I'm crazy enough to hire him.
But I don't understand...
You wouldn't. You're not crazy.
[Dolan is unhitching Dan's stagecoach horses]
Having trouble?
Not me. I'm having fun!
[Using reverse psychology, Dude convinces Slim to fight Dan]
He's just waitin' for you to start something!
Well, I'm an accommodating guy. I'll wait for him in the bar.
I've got some money burning a hole in my pocket.
When you put that fire out, come and see me.
[Dan leads a henchman away to be questioned]
What do you expect to find out from him?
Oh, to see if two and two make four or twelve and eight make twenty.
They might shoot!
Uh-huh. So might I - and I'm a lot closer!
[fearing that Dan has stolen their gold, the miners stop his stagecoach]
I'll vouch for him!
Who'll vouch for you?
What'll I tell them?
Tell 'em you're Santy Claus and you've come to take back your presents.
[commenting on Caroline's half-burned stagecoach, which has been "repaired" with oilskin and wallpaper]
If you see that patchwork on the road, don't let it pass you - it might scare the horses.
[recurring line]
And don't call me Boggsie!
[last lines]
With my compliments - the finest baby rattle west of the Mississippi!
